pages.text: Andiva ivantsovi comes from the Upper Ediacaran, with fossils found from the White Sea, Russia; and the Flinders Ranges, South Australia. It is a quilted lifeform that was able to move around in order to get food, and could grow up to 10 cm in length. It has been proposed that Andiva bore a 'carapace' at the front of its body, to perhaps protect itself from sharp rocks and stones in the way.
The generic & specific name derives from Andrei Yu. Ivantsov, who is a well known Russian Ediacaran paleontologist, and also aided in collecting the fossil material for the first study of Andiva.
